CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, November 21, 1942, pg. 11, reads: "Women At War Drive Large Trucks Across The Country - Everywhere women are aiding in was effort. They are assuming newer responsibilities in their determination to help our men win the war against the Axis powers.  Here petite Rebecca Jefferson, of Pittsburgh, is shown standing beside the large truck which she drove from Cleveland to Pittsburgh in a test run for a local automobile firm.  She said: "It was easy." At right, she is looking under the hood of the three-and-a-half-ton truck to discover a slight bit of motor trouble.  Other trips will be made by Miss Jefferson and over longer routes, the Pittsburgh firm has indicated.-Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Rebecca Jefferson wearing plaid jacket, seated in driver's seat of truck
